_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The owners,   management  and employees of the DeLong Co., Inc. are committed  to the
prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia   Through training local 
emergency responders and  employees, if  an accidental release should occur the facility 
is prepared  to work with the  local fire department   or other authorities to mitigate any
release and impact of the release to people and the environment.
FACILITY INFORMATION

The DeLong Co., Inc. is a member of the Fertilizer 100.   Meaning  they are one of the largest 100 fertilizer dealers in the nation and one of the biggest in WI. They  employ more  than 
85 people company wide. There are actually five divisions   in The DeLong Co., Inc.  Chick DeLong  is in charge of feed.  Bo DeLong is in charge of grain.  Dan DeLong is in charge of  DeLco Transport.  Steve Quade is in charge of the  seed division. David DeLong, president, is in charge of fertilizer and chemicals.  The primary activity at the facility is the storage, distribution and application of  anhydrous ammonia for stateline area farmers.  The maximum  quantity stored would be 140,196 lbs. in our 30,000 gallon storage tank. The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a rail tank car holding 150,000 lbs.

 WORST-CASE

The worst-case release scenario would be the release of  the entire contents of a storage tank or tank car released as a gas over 10 minutes. The maximum quantity released would be 150,000 pounds which represents the volume of the largest storage tank at 85 percent of capacity as limited by design standards.  The distance to the endpoint (point of dispersion  to 200 ppm) is 1.1 miles.

ALTERNATIVE-CASE

The alternative release scenario based on the five-year accident history or the most likely
potential incident is a release from a break in a transfer hose. The distance to the endpoint
(point of  dispersion to 200 ppm ) is 0.41 miles.

PREVENTION PROGRAM

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirement

s" for the storage and
handling of  anhydrous ammonia, K-61.1 published by the American National Standards
Institute Inc. and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration
(OSHA) 29 CFR 1010.111  storage, age and handling of anhydrous ammonia and the company
random safety spot check.

FIVE -YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no accidental releases OF anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:
have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility nor to our
knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property
damage, or environmental damage.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE

The company has it's emergency response unit and team  ready for any accidental releases of
anhydrous ammonia plus a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard
23 CFR 1910.38.

We provide state and local authorities the emergency planning and community sight-to-know
information as required under Sara Title III EPCRA and a written emergency response program
in accordance with OSHA  standard 29CFR 1910.120 including pre-emergency planning and
employee training.

PLANNED CHANGES   TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Safety improvement  is an on going process at The DeLong Co., Inc.  Periodic evaluation are performed to access the maintenance and safety conditions. There are no additional specific
anhydrous ammonia  safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
